serviceDescription: Full Metadata Two methods proposed by Weaver et. al (2017) are applied to the entire United States using a combination of population and housing unit data from the 1990, 2000 and 2010 Decennial Censuses with available state level domestic well completion reports for domestic wells constructed between April 1, 1990 and March 31, 2010 in twenty-one states.
description: U.S. Census, Steven Manson, Jonathan Schroeder, David Van Riper, and Steven Ruggles. IPUMS National Historical Geographic Information System: Version 12.0 [Database]. Minneapolis: University of Minnesota. 2017. http://doi.org/10.18128/D050.V12.0, Arizona Department of Water Resources, Arkansas Water Well Construction Commission, Colorado Department of Natural Resources, Idaho Department of Water Resources, Kansas Geological Survey, Kentucky Geological Survey, Lousiana Department of Natural Resources, Maine Department of Agriculture, Conservation and Forestry, Maryland Department of the Environment, Michigan Department of Environmental Quality, Minnesota Geological Survey, Missouri Department of Natural Resources, Montana Ground Water Information Center, Nebraska Department of Natural Resources, Nevada Division of Water Resources, New Jersey Department of Environmental Protection, New Mexico Office of the State Engineer, Ohio Department of Natural Resources, Oklahoma Water Resources Board, Vermont Department of Environmental Conservation, Wyoming Sate Engineer's Office.

documentInfo.Title: 2010 U.S. Domestic Well Use Estimates
documentInfo.Author: Fran Kreamer
documentInfo.Comments: Two methods proposed by Weaver et. al (2017) are applied to the entire United States using a combination of population and housing unit data from the 1990, 2000 and 2010 Decennial Censuses with available state level domestic well completion reports for domestic wells constructed between April 1, 1990 and March 31, 2010 in twenty-one states.
documentInfo.Subject: This map service provides an estimate of domestic well use in 2010 for all US Census block groups.
